statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: BYU 89, Wyoming 81
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Keena Young scored a career high 29 points, including 21 in the second half, and pulled down 10 rebounds to lead Brigham Young past Wyoming 89-81 Tuesday night. The win pushes the Cougars' home court winning streak to 26 games, second longest in the nation. The score was tied at 45 with 15:16 remaining when BYU (13-5, 3-1 Mountain West) scored 17 unanswered points to capture a 62-45 lead with 10:21 left. Young, whose previous scoring record was 27, scored nine and Mike Rose added five points during the run. Wyoming (11-7, 2-2 Mountain West) was able to chip away at the Cougar lead and closed to within five at 82-77 on a basket by Eric Platt with 1:27 remaining, but could get no closer. In the first half, the Cowboys led by as many as 10 when James Spencer hit a jump shot with 13:39 remaining until halftime. The Cougars closed the half on a 10-3 run capped by a 3-pointer by Jonathan Tavernari. Wyoming was led by Brandon Ewing and Daaron Brown who each scored 22 points. Brown also pulled down a game-high 18 rebounds. Trent Plaisted scored 15 for the Cougars and Austin Ainge added 13. Tavernari scored 10 for the Cougars, all in the first half on 4-of-4 from the field and 2-of-2 from the free throw line.
